gwt.g3d.client.primitive
Class PrimitiveFactory

java.lang.Object
  gwt.g3d.client.primitive.PrimitiveFactory

public class PrimitiveFactory
extends java.lang.Object

Factory for creating primitive meshes. This class was originally written for CS467/468 (Computer Graphics II and Practicum) by Kavita Bala Copyright 2009 Computer Science Department, Cornell University

Author:
Adam Arbree -- arbree@cs.cornell.edu, Wenzel Jakob, Shuang Zhao, Joann Luu, hao1300@gmail.com

Constructor Detail

PrimitiveFactory

public PrimitiveFactory()
Method Detail

makePlane

public static MeshData makePlane()
Creates a plane lying on the xz-plane 2 units in width and length. The plane's normal is the positive y-axis.

Returns:
the mesh data that describes the plane.

makeBox

public static MeshData makeBox()
Creates the box [-1,-1] to [1,1]

makeCone

public static MeshData makeCone(int stacks,
                                int slices)
Creates a cone. The cone is exactly, 2 units high and 1 unit in radius at the base. The cone is oriented along the y-axis. The number of slices is the number of subdivisions around the circumference of the cone (at the base) and stacks is the number of subdivisions along the height.

Parameters:
stacks -
slices -

makeCylinder

public static MeshData makeCylinder(int stacks,
                                    int slices)
Creates a cylinder. The cylinder is exactly, 2 units high and 1 unit in radius. The cylinder is oriented along the y-axis. The number of slices is the number of subdivisions around the circumference of the cylinder and stacks is the number of subdivisions along the height.

Parameters:
stacks -
slices -

makeSphere

public static MeshData makeSphere(int stacks,
                                  int slices)
Makes a 1 unit radius sphere centered at the origin. The number of slices is the number of divisions along the equator and stacks is the number of divisions along any meridian.

Parameters:
stacks -
slices -
